metadata.title: Gallons to Liters (gal to L) Converter – Official Standard
metadata.description: Convert US liquid gallons to liters using the exact international standard. Get NIST-traceable results for fuel, industrial, and scientific applications.

introduction: This gallons to liters converter provides scientifically accurate results for professionals and consumers working with liquid volumes.
Every calculation uses the exact formula where 1 US liquid gallon equals 3.785411784 liters, ensuring your conversions are precise for fuel economy, recipes, and international trade.

We provide the official formula, worked examples, and authoritative context to help you convert gallons to liters with confidence, distinguishing between the US and imperial gallon to prevent costly errors.
methodology: To convert US liquid gallons (gal) to liters (L), the calculator multiplies the gallon value by exactly 3.785411784.

This conversion factor is based on the definition of the US liquid gallon as exactly 231 cubic inches. The inch, in turn, is defined as exactly 2.54 centimeters by the 1959 International Yard and Pound Agreement, linking the gallon to the metric system.
This standard is recognized by the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) and is the basis for all official volume conversions in the United States for commerce and science.
examples: Fuel Economy: A car with a 15-gallon fuel tank has a capacity of approximately 56.78 liters, a common unit for fuel in countries using the metric system.
Industrial Use: A 55-gallon drum of a chemical is equivalent to about 208.2 liters, a critical conversion for international shipping manifests and safety data sheets.
Cooking: A recipe calling for 1 gallon of stock requires 3.785 liters, allowing for accurate scaling of recipes between US customary and metric systems.

faqs.question: What is the exact formula to convert gallons to liters?
faqs.answer: The official formula is: Liters = US Gallons × 3.785411784. This is an exact definition, not a rounded number.

faqs.question: How many liters are in a gallon?
faqs.answer: There are exactly 3.785411784 liters in one US liquid gallon. For quick estimates, this is often rounded to 3.79.

faqs.question: Is this the US gallon or the UK (imperial) gallon?
faqs.answer: This calculator converts the US liquid gallon. The imperial gallon is a different unit, equal to about 4.546 liters, or approximately 20% larger than the US gallon. Using the wrong one can lead to significant measurement errors.

faqs.question: Why is using an exact conversion factor important?
faqs.answer: Using the exact factor is critical for scientific accuracy, international trade, and any application where cumulative errors are unacceptable. It ensures that measurements are consistent and interoperable across different systems.

glossary.definition: A unit of volume in the U.S. customary system, defined as exactly 231 cubic inches, or 3.785411784 liters.
A metric unit of volume, defined as 1 cubic decimeter (dm³). It is the standard unit for liquid volume in most of the world.
A unit of volume in the British imperial system, defined as 4.54609 liters. It is about 20% larger than the US liquid gallon.
